article.headline: Siena 66, Marist 59
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. -- Clarence Jackson scored 19 points after missing six games with an ankle injury to lead Siena to a 66-59 win over Marist on Friday night. Jackson came off the bench to hit five 3-pointers, helping the Saints (6-10, 3-3 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) win their eighth straight game over their arch-rivals and snap their five-game road losing streak. Ryan Rossiter completed his 12th double-double of the season with 15 points and 13 boards and OD Anosike had 13 points and nine rebounds for Siena. The Saints never trailed, taking a 32-28 lead into halftime. The Red Foxes (4-14, 3-3) got within a point on three occasions, the last time at 55-54 with 2:51 left on a Sam Prescott 3-pointer. Jackson answered with a 3 and Rossiter scored on a three-point play to end the threat. Prescott scored 15 to lead Marist, which was 5 of 23 from 3-point range.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
